content: sedge stitch crochet hat by jackie henderson video showing how to crochet this hat can be found here on my youtube channel jacqknits https //youtu be/dtzvri6vrk8 materials size 4 5mm crochet hook yarn used worsted weight yarn color theory two wands colors shown caper and tourmaline yardage approx 230 yards gauge 4 x4 19 stitches 14 row in ribbing size small medium large abbreviations chain = chain yoslst = yarn over slip_stitch © jacq knits blo = back loop only single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet decrease = single_crochet two together pattern ribbing with size 4 5 mm hook chain 25 25 25 for folded brim 13 13 13 for unfolded brim row 1 in 2nd chain from hook yoslst and in each chain to the end ch1 turn row 2 staring with 2nd chain from hook yoslst blo in every stitch ch1 turn repeat row 2 for a total of 60 63 66 row or till length of fabric stretches sungly around your head it must be a multipe of 3 row sedge stitch for body row 1 ch1 and pick up stitches along the side of the brim single_crochet one stitch at the end of each row total stitches 60 63 66 or for how many row you made your brim ch1 turn row 2 in 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet double_crochet in same stitch skip 2 stitches * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in same stitch skip 2 stitches* repeat till 2 stitches remain single_crochet in last stitch ch1 turn repeat row 2 till hat measures 10 11 13 from foundation chain for folded brim 8 9 11 from foundation chain for unfolded brim decrease rounds row 1 starting with 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in every stitch ch1 turn row 2 starting with 2nd chain from hook *single_crochet decrease* repeat to end row 3 starting with 2nd chain from hook *decrease* repeat to end ch1 and cut off yarn leaving a bit of a tail fold hat in half and seam sides together using your favorite seaming stitch weave in the tail from your last row of crocheting in and out of your last row of crochet and pull to cinch close the top stitch a few stitches to securely close that gap for the top of your hat weave in ends add a pom pom if desired © jacq knits
